title: The Hindu Editorial | Intent and outcome  On India’s climate budget for 2026 27 | 06.02.2026
description: India’s Union Budget 2026‑27 marks another step in the country’s green transition but with a familiar pattern of big intentions and cautious allocations. The government has announced a ₹20,000‑crore, five‑year outlay for Carbon Capture, Utilisation and Storage (CCUS), signalling India’s shift into the pilot and demonstration phase of this complex technology. While CCUS is crucial for hard‑to‑abate sectors like steel, cement and aluminium, global experience from Norway, Canada and the U.S. shows that scaling it remains costly and uneven.

This decline, exacerbated by concerns over Federal Reserve policy and tech sector weakness, has impacted companies holding digital assets and erased gains since Trump's election.

title: No compromise till Sukhbir resigns as SAD chief: Ex-SGPC chief
‘Ee sala cup namdu’: Mandhana hails ‘3 titles in 3 years’ as RCB’s golden run continues
description: Smriti Mandhana led Royal Challengers Bengaluru to their second WPL title, defeating Delhi Capitals by six wickets.  Mandhana praised the team's belief and the support staff's clarity, dedicating the win to the passionate RCB fanbase.  Georgia Voll's aggressive batting and Lauren Bell's bowling were crucial in the successful chase of 204.

Sub-zero shock in Manali: Mumbai woman dies after sudden shivering during Solang Valley visit
description: A Mumbai tourist tragically died from suspected cold exposure in Manali's freezing Solang Valley. Meanwhile, Kullu witnessed a rare winter landslide, and avalanches pose a threat in higher altitudes.  A minor earthquake also rattled Kinnaur.  These events highlight the severe weather conditions gripping Himachal Pradesh.

description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured their second Women's Premier League championship. They defeated Delhi Capitals in a thrilling final on Thursday. Captain Smriti Mandhana played a pivotal role with a remarkable innings. This victory marks a significant achievement for the team. The win also holds personal significance for the captain and the team.

title: Savannah Guthrie’s missing mother: Family pleads for answers in new video
description: An 84-year-old woman, Nancy Guthrie, mother of "Today" show host Savannah Guthrie, remains missing after her suspected abduction from her Tucson home. Investigators are treating ransom notes demanding millions in bitcoin as credible, with deadlines set for Thursday and Monday. The family has pleaded for direct contact to confirm her well-being.

title: Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'They wanted to become Korean,' says father
description: Three sisters in Ghaziabad allegedly died by suicide, with preliminary findings suggesting heavy influence from Korean online content and games. Their father acknowledged financial stress but denied it as a cause, stating the girls lived in a fantasy world. Neighbors noted the sisters' isolation and lack of interaction, with their schooling being irregular and academic performance below average.

Farmers, activists and government officials say the migrants have become indispensable to farm operations here even as local youth step away from fieldwork. K. Shiva Shanker traces the forces reshaping farm labour in the State

title: 'No cash, take my radish': Farmer protests 'bribe' demand over pending farm road in Karnataka
description: A farmer's unique protest in Bengaluru, using radishes to highlight alleged bribery demands by revenue officials, has brought attention to stalled civic work. Prasanna Kumar staged his demonstration after a Lokayukta order for a farm approach road remained unfulfilled for months. He claims officials sought money, offering his produce as an alternative to payment.

title: Ghaziabad suicides: Dad deleted girls’ YouTube channel over 'Korea obsession' — what autopsy reveals
description: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, tragically died by suicide in Ghaziabad after their father objected to their deep fascination with Korean culture and K-dramas. Their YouTube channel, dedicated to this passion, was deleted shortly before their deaths. The girls, who had become increasingly isolated, reportedly lived in a fantasy world, dreaming of visiting Korea.

IndiGo’s December disruption stranded 16.2 lakh domestic flyers: DGCA
description: The directorate’s monthly traffic data for Dec 2025 says 16.2 lakh domestic flyers were stranded at airports across the country due to the non-availability of either IndiGo aircraft or their crew members. The number of people affected due to total cancellation of flights was 9.8 lakh, while those stranded at the airports due to delays beyond two hours were 6.4 lakh.

title: 5 LCA Mk1A fighter jets fully ready for delivery to IAF: HAL
description: HAL said that “an additional nine aircraft have already been built and flown. Upon receipt of engines from General Electric (US company), these aircraft will be made ready for delivery”. “All design and development issues identified are being addressed in an expedited manner. HAL is in active discussions with IAF to deliver the aircraft at the earliest,” it said in a statement.

title: Impact of US sanctions: India import of Russian crude in Dec lowest since Feb 2025
description: The US had announced sanctions on the two companies on Oct 22 and set Nov 21 as the deadline for all dealings with them to be wound down. As per data shared by the ministry of commerce and industry, Dec supplies of Russian oil were nearly 27% lower compared with imports worth $3.7 billion a month earlier in Nov 2025, and over 15% lower than the $3.2 billion imported during the corresponding month in 2024.

title: Married woman can’t claim rape on false marriage promise: Supreme Court
description: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said in such cases, a woman was not eligible to get married due to the subsistence of her marriage and she could not invoke the ground of false promise of marriage. It passed the order while quashing criminal proceedings against a lawyer on a complaint filed by a woman advocate alleging that he had raped her on the false promise of marriage.

title: Bulls vs Raptors injury report: Who’s out, questionable, and starting Feb 5
description: Chicago Bulls and Toronto Raptors clash Thursday, both battling for Eastern Conference playoff spots amidst significant roster disruptions.  With key players sidelined due to trades and injuries, this game hinges on depth, rebounding, and guard play. The Bulls have dominated the season series, but Toronto's defense aims to challenge Chicago's depleted lineup.

title: NHL prospect Gavin McKenna released on $20K bail after felony assault
description: Penn State forward and top 2026 NHL draft prospect Gavin McKenna was arrested on felony assault charges following an altercation near campus. McKenna, facing aggravated assault and other charges, was released on $20,000 bail. The incident reportedly involved McKenna punching a victim, causing facial injuries requiring surgery.

title: ‘I have no clue about this’: Anurag Kashyap on being named in Epstein files, says it’s ‘some random email’

description: New Orleans Saints quarterback Tyler Shough has earned the Pepsi Zero Sugar NFL Rookie of the Year award. Stepping in mid-season, he revitalized the Saints' campaign, leading them to a winning record in their final nine games.

title: YouTube reveals $60bn revenue in 2025, surpassing Netflix for the first time
description: YouTube has officially revealed its impressive financial performance, generating over $60 billion in revenue for 2025 through advertising and paid subscriptions. This significant figure surpasses Netflix and highlights YouTube's evolution into a dominant global media powerhouse. The platform's growth is fueled by increasing viewer engagement and a strong performance from its subscription services.

The region refers to the mountainous belt along the Pir Panjal range south of Kashmir valley and close to the LoC.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: How BJP plans to do a Bihar in state and will it be enough?
description: The BJP is attempting to replicate its Bihar electoral strategy in Tamil Nadu by consolidating opposition forces and forming a broad social alliance across major caste segments. Aiming to counter the DMK, the party is forging alliances with former partners and breakaway factions, including the AIADMK and PMK, to build a wider NDA for the upcoming assembly elections.

title: ‘With Love’ movie review: Anaswara Rajan’s cute rom-com lacks emotional heft
description: Though written with a lot of heart and a conviction to make a simple and sweet meet-cute, debutant Madhan’s film ends up as a middling rom-com that lacks inner scaffolding

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.

title: Manoj Bajpayee's 'Ghooskhor Pandat' lands in controversy: Legal notice sent to makers — Here's why
description: Manoj Bajpayee's new film 'Ghooskhor Pandat' is already making waves, but not quite in the way the team expected. Following its announcement, the film has attracted a storm of criticism for its provocative title, prompting legal notices to Netflix and its director. Critics accuse the film of unfairly associating the Pandit community with unethical practices.

title: Chor machaye shor: Caught stealing, thief files assault complaint against attackers in B'luru
description: An auto driver, caught stealing electrical equipment from a Bengaluru house, filed a police complaint claiming he was assaulted by residents. The homeowner also filed a counter-complaint, stating the trio attacked them with a beer bottle. Police have arrested the driver and his associates.

title: Loud music may damage your hearing before you realise it
description: Research has shown that prolonged exposure to loud noise can damage synapses without affecting the hearing threshold; since clinical assessments bank on this threshold, a normal audiogram need not mean no hearing damage

title: The story of the India Mark II hand pump
description: From drought-hit India to sub-Saharan Africa, how a simple design transformed access to water.

title: In the stars

title: Mystery of the creaky house
description: A rainy evening, a strange old house, and an eerie old lady ... a visit to a friend’s house turns into an adventure.
